title: Can we talk about Poppy?
body:
Poppy doesn't always win her games, but she kind of always wins in her own way. How many times during World's did we see teams pick Poppy into losing match-ups, end up down 40+ cs, and yet as soon as she builds Sunfire she becomes impossible to deal with regardless of how rough her laning phase was.

You can't gank her. She can knock the entire team away, charge off, speed herself up, and slow you on top of being generally difficult to kill in the first place. You can't starve her because all she needs is one item and one good W, E, or R to shift an entire fight. Even the go-to anti "wall of stats" champion Trundle can't do anything to Poppy. She stuns him against his own pillar and runs away while having more presence in 5v5. He can't even touch her 1v1 with Subjugate up.

She's incredibly tanky and brings lots of crowd control along with respectable damage. She's really good at disrupting, really good at making picks, really good at disengaging, and really good at teamfighting. So how exactly is Poppy meant to be kept down? What other tanks can compete with her? The only one I can think of that comes close to bringing her level of disruption and mobility is tank Ekko.

I know the feeling. I was 3/0 top lane a few games ago against a Poppy with 50+ more cs than her. Then once she got sunfire I could not kill her no matter how hard I tried.

Items that give Health and Armor make someone harder to kill? Whoda thunk it.

Sunfire gives you a lot of resistnace to being killed from physical damage, while also passively damaging things around you. The other closely related items are Randuin's and Deadman's.
Randuin's does nothing in lane to help you against basically anyone you will fight, beyond the stats it gives. +10 armor isn't worth it.
Deadman's gives the same stats, and a passive that gives movespeed, which is irrelevant unless roaming. Poppy has an ability that boost movespeed, so this passive is not needed. The second part of the passive deals increased damage to a single target. Sunfire deals more damage overall because it has an AoE effect.

Sunfire is literally the best item a tank toplaner could buy against someone who doesn't have hard AP scalings.
It's not even overpowered statwise, it's just got the best passives among the three big Health/Armor tank items for a tank toplaner.

poppy gets insanely tanky off of items because of her overpowered W passive that gives her an extra 15% of armor and MR and 30% extra armor and MR when she's at 40% or lower HP.

this combined with the fact that she has a % health scaling shield that's up every 10 seconds make her impossible to kill unless you have a whole team focusing her down.

on top of this, if you try to fight her you'll lose because of her INSANE damage on her q which has a pretty good base damage and does **14% of the enemy's maximum health** and it's not like her other abilities don't do damage, too.
14% if you get caught in both blasts and can be reduced by armor. Her shield isn't guaranteed either since she has to walk where it lands.
Who were you playing?
Jayce

That is exactly what I expected. A tank building full armour in the early game is going to counter a flat pen-stacking squishy killer like Jayce at that point of the game, kills aside. It's exactly the same as a tank rushing Spirit Visage being able to completely ignore the enemy team's mages even if they're super fed.

Squishies lose to tanks once tanks get any kind of tankiness via items whatsoever until very late in the game, depending on build (I don't think 6 item Jayce could deal with a 6 item tank either). That's something you're supposed to expect when taking someone like Jayce top. Get fed off the tank like you did and then ignore them when they get tankier because you're better off using your lead to kill squishies in other lanes. 

If you got 3 kills off a tank and decided that the best use of your time was to continue fighting the tank then you just fucked up. You could so easily have went mid and bot, murdered them a bunch and ended the game super early.

Yes, even the shout casters mentioned that Poppy is a good pick when your top laner is the team's weak link.

Also if ulti isn't used right and E doesn't hit a wall she can be ignored and most of her team taken out.

Her true power is really showcased through coordinated teams like in worlds. So it makes sense that she'd seem very powerful there. 

Honestly if Poppy kept 1v1ing trundle late game and winning than I'd see some reason to be concerned. But she kept focusing the minions because any lone duel against Trundle would be in his favor. 

Her damage is only high to squishy targets in certain circumstances (wall stun) plus sunfire also hurts squishies when around for an extended period. Against someone like Trundle, only her Q is going to hurt due to %health.

Just because the good picks against a champion are not played at Worlds does not mean they do not exist and are good in non-pro play.

Did she save her dash to cancell your stun though? Because in my experience poppy wins from sion.

Her base damage values are too high (yes, I know she's a tank, please read). Watching her build 100% defensively and still deal notable damage is frustrating, especially given even Trundle had to build a Ravenous Hydra. This fact became especially noticeable during Worlds, where her worse matchup involved playing against Trundle of all champions and she basically had to go full damage sponge. Even then, if she caught a carry then they were dead, and she had zero bonus AD ratios to accomplish it (QER damage require bonus AD). Even with the argument "BUT THEY HAD NO RESISTANCES", Poppy did not have Bonus AD of any kind to bolster her damage. 

If Riot made it to where she only needed to buy a small amount of AD (Titanic Hydra, Cleaver, Triforce) to make up the difference, I'd be okay with it. But her itemization is way too easy for the damage she does, which warps her intended strengths and weaknesses.

That doesn't even mention how she can just ding a target into the air with her ultimate, not even needing to wind it up, with almost no time for her opponent to react. Poppy's ultimate is powerful and the whole point of the wind-up is to broadcast that she is about to cast it. What isn't okay is that she uses it as a cheap knockup with almost no counterplay due to the abysmal window her target has to react.

Edit: I am trying to contribute to the discussion here. Stop downvoting because you simply disagree.
Poppy's base damages high? Isn't that.... how a tank works?

Is Poppy a conventional tank though? Looking at her playstyle, she aligns closer to a diver and a fighter than a tank. I'd even argue that Poppy's being a tank is beside the point. If you look at Irelia and then look back at Poppy, you'll understand what I mean. 

It's not that she has high base damage as a tank, but how that calculates into her kit and how that benefits from largely safe itemization. The problem is that her itemization and kit detract from her interactions because she turns into a ball of defensive stats that has the same kill potential as a Fighter with less defensive stats.  

Sorry if my meaning did not come across that well in my main post.

Her playstyle is that she is meant to peel for her carries, but her most successful style is being able to lockdown a single target if they get caught out.  Before her E range nerfs, this was much more noticeable.

In essence she's more of a Warden/diver hybrid, though I think the diver part shows more in the LCS because offensive tactics seem to be more rewarded than defensive tactics.  I could be wrong though.

Poppy has no damage. The only situation I see poppy dealing damage is to an adc who can't kite properly. I even went full tank and my teammates asked if I actually do damage. I was fighting an Elise btw.

Based off what I saw at Worlds, I don't find this to be entirely true, which is my point. As Ralanr pointed out, LCS pros used her for more offensive tactics and showed how her damage does come out early into midgame. Obvious it teetered as they went past midgame (as base damage typically does), so the question should be "Is Poppy supposed to be a fighter that transforms naturally into a tank?" Then my follow-up would be "Is that healthy given her safety?" 

I'm making an assertion that her base ability damage is too high without needing to use her Bonus AD ratios, given she turns into a defensive ball of stats later no matter how good or poor she does.

As a Poppy player myself, she is not as strong as you think.

I play her Top, Jg, and Support (shocking I know XD).

Some keys points when fighting her:

1) Avoid walls. That allows her to stun you and follow up with a full Q hit and maybe even a knock up from her ult to allow her to stun you again.

2) Don't stand in the slow area from her Q because you are asking to take more damage.

3) Build armor penetration items since most Poppy's build tank.

4) Never group in teamfights. She has a greater chance of hitting her ult if you group.

Now when I play Poppy, I build her sort of Bruiser like... Black Cleaver, Swifites, Warmog, DMP, Botrk, and Titanic Hydra are my goto items for her. She is Tanky but still has the dmg needed to hold her own plus the life steal to stay in the fight and ms to get into the fight.
